content.question:
<math alttext="H X, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>HX</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math><math alttext="H Z, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>HZ</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>Conductivitylowhigh
A student tests the electrical conductivity of <math alttext="0.10 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></math> solutions of two different monoprotic acids, <math alttext="H X, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>HX</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and <math alttext="H Z, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>HZ</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>. Results from the experiment are shown in the table. Which of the following is a question that could be answered based on the data in the table?

choices.label: Which acid has the larger <math alttext="K a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>a</mi></msub></math> value?
Which acid has the larger molar mass?
Which acid solution has the larger density?
Which acid solution has the larger standard molar entropy?

content.answer: Which acid has the larger <math alttext="K a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>a</mi></msub></math> value?

skill.text: 2.A: Identify a testable scientific question based on an observation, data, or a model.
